data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Each step forward is always 9 steps, so you always go 0 and going forward, as you should always. Each step left is one step, and each step right is one step, so you always go 0 and going backward, as you should always. All directions always turn in order of facing forward. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The starting point can be turned around from and to. The direction of the direction of the walk could be turned from right to left. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You take 4 steps that return you to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
To turn left, you begin the backwards motion of 7 steps. 5 steps backward. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you return to the starting point, take 10 steps. If you stop and turn right, take 9 steps.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Turn right. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Turn left. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Turn left () until you get to the starting point. If you follow the directions from the start point backwards, you are left in a circle for 7 steps. If you turn around right, you now have a circle for 7 steps. Turn right () until you get to the beginning point and turn around. If you follow the directions from the start point backwards, you are right in a circle for 7 steps. If you turn around left, you now have a circle for 7 steps. That means if you do this you will get back to the starting point. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn right. Turn right. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The first instruction was taken 8 steps and the second one was taken 9. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Turn around. Take 8 steps. Take 2 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The starting point is at the beginning of the instructions. The instructions to take 6 steps, turn around, take 8 steps, and take 2 steps are repeated. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If an object is facing forward - always facing forward and walking forward – then the point at which we start is the same as where we started the exercise. If an object is facing left - always facing left and moving forward - where we stand still for an entire second, is the point at which we start the exercise. If an object is facing right - always facing right and walking forward - where there is a line of sight parallel to our starting point, then the point at which we start the exercise is the point at which we exit the exercise. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 3 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You must turn around to take 2 steps. If you were to turn around 5 times in this manner, you would take 15 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 3 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
It is dangerous to always face forward and take 1 step backward. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 5 steps left. Take 2 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

The person who is facing forward always faces forward. If you take 1 step backward, we are moving right. If you take 6 steps backward, we are going to go back forward. The person who is facing forward never takes a step backward. If you take 5 steps left, we are moving left. If you take 2 steps left, we are moving left. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps left. Take 3 steps left. Take 1 step left. Take 3 steps backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 4 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 3 steps left. Take 1 step left. Take 6 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 4 steps right. So, the answer is Yes.

To go back to the starting point, all one can do is take 3 steps forward, which is the same as taking 4 steps left. Thus, the answer is no.

Taking 6 steps left is the same as taking 3 steps right. The second part of each of his moves needs one more step. So, the answer is no.

Turn around and turn around. 4 steps are equal to 8 steps. 10 steps are equal to 10 steps. 8 steps are equal to 8 steps. So, the answer is No.

If you take 3 steps first you are taking 3 steps first and then make 9 steps. Make 9 steps and then make 3 steps and then make 6 steps. If you take 6 steps first then make 5 steps first and then make 3 steps. If you take 5 steps first and then make 6 steps then make 3 steps then make 6 steps. So, the answer is No.

Turn right makes you turn around. Turning around makes you turn right. So, the answer is Yes.

Turn around, take 1 step, take 2 steps, take 9 steps, take 7 steps. So, the answer is no.

Turn right. Take 1 step 1 step 1. Take 1 step 2 steps 2. Take 5 steps 3. Take 1 step 3 steps 4, 5, 5 Steps 1. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow the first or second description all the way to the next step you will be back at the starting point. The answer: yes.

Take 10 steps. You can take two steps. Take 10 steps. So, the answer is No.

For first step, you should always face forward. For second step, take 7 steps left. You will first take 7 steps left and then 2 steps right. After step 2, you will take 4 steps right and then 4 steps left. Step 3 is the 7th step; for the second step, take 7 steps forward. Step 4 is the 4th step; for the third step, take 7 steps backward. So, the answer is yes.

Every person who goes backward has to go forward 8 times. Every person who goes left has to go left 8 times. So, the answer is Yes.

If you are in a circle, you will travel the same distance. If you are going backwards, you will take the same number of steps. So, the answer is yes.

One can only go 3 steps backward. Another can only go 2 steps backward. They are not mutually exclusive. So, the answer is yes.

To return to a starting point, always face forward. To take backward actions, always face right. The starting point is always facing forward. If you follow the instructions, you can always return to the starting point. Thus, the answer is Yes.

If you turn around 7 steps, you will return to the starting point. If you turn around and back around 5 steps, you will return to the starting point. There are multiple ways to return to a starting point. Thus, the answer is no.

The correct way to take 6 steps forward is to take 6 steps, the opposite of 9 steps backward. Being right, is same as Forward. Getting 6 steps forward is 6 steps forward from Point A. The correct way to take 4 steps forward is to take 4 steps forward, the opposite of 9 steps backward. Getting 1 step backward is 1 step backward from Point A. So, the answer is no.
